author: Míriam González
title: Una sola tableta de chocolate consume hasta 1.700 litros de agua: así impacta el desperdicio de alimentos en el cambio climático
text: [La sequía se intensifica en España](https://www.infobae.com/espana/2024/02/13/la-sequia-en-espana-afecta-desde-el-campo-a-la-moda-para-sembrar-una-manzana-necesitamos-70-litros-de-agua/) debido a la falta de lluvias. La situación en regiones como Cataluña y Andalucía es especialmente complicada, las reservas de agua están llegando a su límite. De hecho, actualmente los embalses se encuentran al 15,20% de su capacidad total. Ante esta situación, las autoridades públicas están implementando medidas como la restricción del uso del agua en actividades no esenciales y la promoción de un uso responsable entre los ciudadanos. La conservación medioambiental pasa por un desarrollo económico sostenible. De esta forma, el desperdicio de alimentos es también una de las principales causas de un mal consumo del agua. En este sentido, en el marco del Día Mundial del Agua, conmemorado el 22 de marzo, la compañía Too Good To Go ha revelado en cifras la relación entre el desperdicio de alimentos y el derroche de los recursos hídricos del planeta. Los cálculos han sido validados por investigadores de la Universidad de Oxford y WRAP. Te puede interesar: [Ayuso reclama a Marlaska 13.200 facturas que suman 35 millones de euros por la atención sanitaria que Madrid presta a los presos](https://www.infobae.com/espana/2024/03/22/ayuso-reclama-a-marlaska-13200-facturas-que-suman-35-millones-de-euros-por-la-atencion-sanitaria-que-madrid-presta-a-los-presos/?mrfhud=true) La relación entre el consumo de agua y el desperdicio de alimentos: en cifras “Si desperdiciamos menos alimentos, no sólo reducimos una de las mayores fuentes de emisiones de gases de efecto invernadero, sino que también evitamos el uso innecesario de tierra y agua, a gran escala”, ha asegurado la CEO de Too Good To Go, Mette Lykke. Así, en términos de recursos, el consumo de una sola tableta de chocolate de 100 gramos se necesitan hasta 1.700 litros de agua, según un estudio de la organización Hoekstra & Water Footprint Network (2017). Del mismo modo, entre las cifras más sorprendentes se encuentra el coste de preparar una pizza margarita, cifrado en 2.250 litros. Te puede interesar: [El fútbol español, abochornado de nuevo por Rubiales: “Le veo en la cárcel con Piqué, nos olvidamos de la final del Mundial 2030″](https://www.infobae.com/espana/deportes/2024/03/21/el-futbol-espanol-abochornado-de-nuevo-por-rubiales-le-veo-en-la-carcel-con-pique-nos-olvidamos-de-la-final-del-mundial-2030/?mrfhud=true) Estos datos corroboran las declaraciones de la empresaria danesa. “El impacto positivo de evitar el desperdicio de un solo alimento es mayor de lo que la mayoría de la gente piensa. Los alimentos tienen un valor real; no sólo económico, sino también en términos de los recursos que se necesitan para producirlos”, aseguraba. El impacto de la alimentación en el consumo del agua Así, del estudio de Hoekstra & Water Footprint Network (2017), también se han obtenido las siguientes estimaciones: - Una cuña de queso (650 gramos de leche entera de vaca): 2.066 litros - Una baguette: 155 litros - Una bolsa de patatas fritas (125 gramos): 130 litros - Un tomate: 50 litros - Un vaso de leche (250 ml) 255 litros - Una naranja: 80 litros - Un huevo: 200 litros - Una pizza margarita: 1.250 litros - Un vaso de vino tinto (125 ml): 109 litros Del mismo modo, los cálculos, validados por investigadores de la Universidad de Oxford y WRAP, indican que cada Pack de comida salvado a través de la aplicación Too Good To Go evita el uso innecesario de 810 litros de agua. author: Eljie Lagunay
title: ‘Lieutenant Dan’ Seen for the First Time Since Hurricane Milton Passes After Refusing to Leave Boat
text:
# Lieutenant Dan Survives: The One-Legged Sailor Defies Hurricane Milton
 via Shutterstock *Tampa Bay is buzzing with the story of a sailor who braved Hurricane Milton.**
 via Getty Joseph Malinowski, known to many as ‘Lieutenant Dan,’ has become an internet sensation.
 via gettyimages Just days ago, he made headlines for refusing to abandon his boat amid a life-threatening storm.
 via Getty Milton escalated to a devastating Category 5 hurricane before crashing into Florida as a Category 3.
 via Getty Winds reached a staggering 120 mph, leaving over three million people without power.
 via gettyimages Evacuations were ordered, but Malinowski had other plans.
 via shutterstock “God told me to come out here and get a boat,” he boldly declared.
 via Shutterstock He believed his vessel was the safest place to weather the storm.
 via Getty *But what led this one-legged sailor to such defiance?**
 via Shutterstock Malinowski’s backstory is as captivating as his recent antics.
 via Shutterstock A former Navy veteran, he lost his leg in a boating accident years ago.
 via Shutterstock The tragedy left him with a profound connection to the sea.
 via Getty He found solace and purpose in sailing, often referring to his boat as his “home.”
 via Shutterstock Friends describe him as fiercely independent and somewhat of a local legend.
 via Getty Images Known for his adventurous spirit, he had a reputation for taking on challenges headfirst.
 via Mohammed has lived in Tampa for over a decade, having moved from a smaller town in Ohio. So, when Hurricane Milton approached, many knew he wouldn’t back down easily.
 via Getty Images “He’s always been a free spirit,” said a close friend.
 via Getty If you tell him to do one thing, he’ll do the opposite just to prove you wrong.”
 via Getty His determination to stay aboard during the storm was a classic Malinowski move.
 via gettyimages **As the hurricane approached, concern for Lieutenant Dan skyrocketed.**
 via gettyimages His family, meanwhile, struggled with the reality of his loss, conducting memorial services to honor him as though he had passed away.
 via Getty Images **As the hurricane approached, concern for Lieutenant Dan skyrocketed.**
 via Getty News outlets and social media users alike began to worry for his safety.
 via GETTYIMAGES With the storm intensifying, many were left checking their phones for updates.
 via Shutterstock “Every hour, I’m refreshing for a Lieutenant Dan update!” one user tweeted.
 via Getty His antics drew both admiration and criticism.
 via Getty Some applauded his bravery, while others feared for his life.
 via Getty Local police even attempted to persuade him to evacuate.
 via Shutterstock “This isn’t a joke, man,” they warned.
 via Getty But Malinowski was resolute.
 via Getty Images “I’m not going anywhere,” he reportedly replied.
 via : Getty **When the storm finally hit, chaos ensued across the region.**
 via GETTYIMAGES The winds howled, and rain lashed down, causing severe destruction.
 via GETTYIMAGES Streets flooded, trees fell, and buildings suffered damage.
 via gettyimages Yet, in the eye of the storm, one sailor remained stubbornly anchored.
 via Getty NewsNation correspondent Brian Entin decided to check on him.
 via Getty Images Armed with a camera and a mission, he ventured to the bay.
 via Unsplash “Lieutenant Dan!” he called out.
 via shutterstock The moment was tense; would the sailor respond?
 via Getty Images Finally, the top of the boat opened, and Malinowski emerged.
 “I’m fine,” he said nonchalantly.
 via Getty Right now, I’m doing fine. I’m stuck here; I can’t go anywhere.”
 via gettyimages **Social media erupted with relief and humor.**
 via Shutterstock One user joked that Entin had woken him from “the best sleep of his life.”
 via Shutterstock Another shared a TikTok of the “weather warrior” at 4:39 AM, confirming his survival.
 via Shutterstock The updates painted a picture of a man unyielding in his resolve.
 via GETTYIMAGES As the storm recedes, Malinowski stands tall, a testament to the human spirit against nature’s wrath.
 via GETTYIMAGES Lieutenant Dan may be a local legend, but his story of survival will echo far beyond the bay.

author: 新华财经
title: 【环球财经】法国2025年3月CPI小幅上涨0.8% _ 东方财富网
text:
新华财经巴黎4月16日电（记者李文昕）根据法国国家统计和经济研究所15日公布的最终结果，法国2025年3月消费者价格指数（CPI）同比上涨0.8%，涨幅与2月相同；环比下跌0.2%，较2月0.5%的环比跌幅有所收窄。
　　具体来看，法国3月CPI小幅上涨主要归因于制成品季节性涨价，环比涨幅为1.1%，特别是在冬季促销后服装和鞋类价格环比上涨5.7%。
　　由于石油产品价格下跌，3月能源价格继上月环比下跌4.6%后继续下跌1.5%；从同比来看，3月能源价格则下跌6.6%。服务价格尽管环比保持稳定，但同比上升2.3%，主要由 保险 价格加速上涨拉动。此外，食品价格环比回升0.3%，同比上涨0.6%。
（文章来源：新华财经）

author: @GdB_it
title: Bufera sul partner sciamano della principessa norvegese Martha - Giornale di brescia
text: Bufera sul partner sciamano della principessa norvegese Martha STOCCOLMA, 29 DIC - Durek Verrett, il compagno sciamano della principessa norvegese Märtha Louise, figlia del re Harald V, ha suscitato accese polemiche dopo aver pubblicato un video sul suo profilo Instagram in cui offre consigli su come affrontare "lo spirito suicida". Nel video, pubblicato ieri, Verrett ammette che si tratta di un argomento delicato e prosegue dando i suoi consigli da sciamano su come scacciare lo spirito. Le affermazioni hanno suscitato reazioni da parte di diverse persone, tra cui Petter Eide dell'associazione 'Leve', che fornisce supporto ai chi ha tentato di togliersi la vita: "Sostiene che il suicidio sia causato da uno spirito che si è insediato nel corpo e che possa essere scacciato usando la forza mentale." ha affermato Eide al quotidiano norvegese VG. "Non riesco a esprimere quanto mi sconvolga sentire queste sciocchezze. Sta giocando con la vita delle persone", ha aggiunto. Secondo l'Istituto di Sanità Norvegese, oltre 600 persone si tolgono la vita ogni anno in Norvegia, un dato significativo per un Paese con una popolazione di 5,5 milioni di abitanti. A confronto, il numero annuale di vittime per incidenti stradali si aggira intorno alle 100 persone. - [Leggi qui](https://edicola.giornaledibrescia.it/giornalebrescia/newsstand?int_source=leggiqui&int_medium=link&int_campaing=linkinterno&int_content=leggi_qui_il_gdb_in_edicola_oggi)il GdB in edicola oggi - [Iscriviti alle newsletter del GdB](/newsletter/iscriviti). title: Tropical Cyclone Chido Forecast To Hit Zimbabwe On December 17
text:
[Home](/)
[Weather and Climate](/category/weather-and-climate/)
Tropical Cyclone Chido Forecast To Hit Zimbabwe On December 17
The Meteorological Services Department (MSD) announced on Thursday that Zimbabwe may be impacted by Tropical Cyclone Chido, which is currently affecting the northeastern region of Madagascar.
In an advisory, the MSD predicted that Tropical Cyclone Chido is expected to cross into Zimbabwe on December 17.
The cyclone is likely to bring strong winds and heavy rainfall exceeding 70 millimetres within 24 hours in certain areas. Said the MSD:
The tropical system Chido, which is still to the North-East of Madagascar, has intensified into an INTENSE TROPICAL CYCLONE over the past twenty-four hours and its chances of affecting Zimbabwe have greatly increased.
It is likely to cross into Zimbabwe on the 17th of December 2024 bringing with it strong winds and heavy rainfalls of more than 70mm in 24 hours over some places in Manicaland, Masvingo, Mashonaland East, Mashonaland Central, Harare metropolitan and some parts of Midlands and Mashonaland West.
Meanwhile, the Department of Civil Protection has urged citizens to be vigilant for heavy rains, thunderstorms, strong winds, potential flooding, rockfalls, and mudflows.
The public is advised to secure their homes against damaging winds and to establish evacuation plans in preparation for severe weather conditions.
Tropical Cyclone Chido is the third low-pressure system that has threatened Southern Africa this year.
The first storm of the 2024-2025 cyclone season in the southwest Indian Ocean, named Ancha, was designated by the Comoros.
Following this, Cyclone Bheki was named by Eswatini. The name Chido was provided by Zimbabwe.
If another storm forms before the season ends, it will be named Dikeledi, designated by South Africa.
Each year, tropical cyclones are named in alphabetical order, alternating between male and female names.
The list of names is proposed by the National Meteorological and Hydrological Services (NMHSs) of the World Meteorological Organization (WMO) members in a specific region and is approved by the corresponding tropical cyclone regional bodies during their annual or biannual sessions.
Zimbabwe has also provided the name Yemurai for the 25th storm of the season.

text: PITTSBURGH, Pa. — William "Bill" Allen Savage of Pittsburgh, Pa. and formerly of Deep Creek Lake, passed away on Dec. 25, 2023. Bill was born on May 2, 1936, to the late Clarence "Doc" and Marie Savage, owners of Red Run Lodge at Deep Creek Lake. PITTSBURGH, Pa. — William "Bill" Allen Savage of Pittsburgh, Pa. and formerly of Deep Creek Lake, passed away on Dec. 25, 2023. Bill was born on May 2, 1936, to the late Clarence "Doc" and Marie Savage, owners of Red Run Lodge at Deep Creek Lake. In addition to his parents, Bill was preceded in death by his brother, Clarence "Bud" Savage and his wife, Janet Savage. Bill was a graduate from Southern Garrett High School in Oakland, where he was the co-captain of the first Southern Rams Football Team and he played basketball. Bill went on to graduate from the WVU School of Engineering. Bill served in the United States Air Force as a radio communications engineer and was stationed in Saudi Arabia. Bill was a career man for IBM and then PNC Bank. He enjoyed learning to play new instruments and woodworking. Bill leaves behind his son, David (Heather) Savage and his daughter, Laura (Ronald) Golliday; his stepdaughters, Julie (Milton) Honza, Laurie (Mario) Yobbi and Tracy (Mark) Larkin; 10 grandchildren, Christopher (Jessica) and Jonathon Larkin, Morgan (Justin) Jones, Ashtyn (Zach) Gass, Mac (Rebecca) Jamison, Samantha and Nicholas Yobbi, and Madeline, Isabelle, and Daniel Savage; and multiple great-grandchildren.
